emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Autonomous Code Repair
emerging_technologies.description: Tools that can automatically detect, analyze, and repair code issues in real-time, reducing human error and speeding up development cycles.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Increases efficiency in software development, potentially reducing jobs in manual code review but also enhancing product quality and security.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High adoption due to immediate benefits in productivity and security, with challenges in trust and reliability of AI systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: Blockchain systems designed to be secure against quantum computing attacks, enhancing the longevity and security of cryptographic methods.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Ensures the long-term viability of blockchain technologies, critical for financial systems and data integrity.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will depend on the advancement of quantum computing and the perceived threat it poses to current cryptographic systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural-Interface Glasses
emerging_technologies.description: Glasses that use neural interfaces to overlay AR content directly onto the user's visual field, controlled by thought.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize education, entertainment, and accessibility, but raises privacy concerns and potential addiction issues.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will be influenced by ethical considerations, user privacy, and the development of non-invasive neural technologies.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Air Mobility
emerging_technologies.description: Fully autonomous flying vehicles for urban transport, reducing traffic congestion and pollution.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Transforms urban landscapes, reduces travel time but brings new challenges in airspace management and safety.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires regulatory approval, public trust in autonomous flight, and infrastructure development.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI Pair Programming
mainstream_technologies.description: AI tools that not only assist but actively participate in coding, offering suggestions, and implementing code blocks.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted by software development teams, with significant changes in how coding is taught and performed.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Enhanced Renewable Energy Systems
mainstream_technologies.description: AI algorithms optimizing renewable energy production and distribution, significantly increasing efficiency.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard in smart grids and energy management systems, driven by environmental regulations and cost savings.

epoch_themes.description: The integration of AI into the software development lifecycle to enhance productivity, creativity, and efficiency.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Changes the nature of work in software development, potentially reducing entry barriers but also requiring new skill sets.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push towards automation and efficiency in knowledge work, leading to a rise in AI literacy and education.

epoch_themes.description: Technologies aimed at making urban environments more sustainable through intelligent systems and autonomous transport.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes greener cities, reduces carbon footprints, but also necessitates urban planning reforms.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing urbanization worldwide drives demand for sustainable solutions in city planning and transport.
